title: Calories in 2 Tablespoons of Butter
meta_description: Discover calories in 2 tablespoons of butter, including fat, sodium, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with quick tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Standard butter (salted or unsalted); 1 tablespoon = 14 g; room temperature, no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, salted vs. unsalted, and exact measurement; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two tablespoons of butter provide ~204 kcal, mostly from fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whipped butter (less dense) per tablespoon
Switch to unsalted butter per tablespoon
Replace with olive oil per tablespoon

faqs.q: How many calories in one tablespoon of butter?
faqs.a: About 102 kcal per tablespoon of standard butter.

faqs.q: Is butter high in saturated fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 2 tablespoons have ~14.6 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Does unsalted butter have fewer calories?
faqs.a: No, calories are the same; only sodium differs (~2 mg vs. 91 mg per tbsp).
Butter has 0 g carbs, fiber, and sugars per serving.

faqs.q: How does butter compare to margarine calories?
faqs.a: Similar at ~100 kcal per tbsp, but margarine often has less saturated fat.
